title: Oczepiny (Unveiling Ceremony)
shortDescription: Bride's unveiling and tossing of the veil
fullDescription: A traditional Polish custom where the bride removes her veil at midnight, symbolizing her transition from a bride to a wife. The veil is tossed to the unmarried women, similar to tossing the bouquet.

title: Bread and Salt Greeting
shortDescription: Welcoming the couple with bread and salt
fullDescription: Upon arrival at the wedding reception, the newlyweds are greeted by their parents with bread and salt, symbolizing the wish for prosperity (bread) and a life full of challenges (salt).

title: Throwing Glasses Behind Your Back
fullDescription: During the reception, the bride and groom throw glasses behind their backs, symbolizing the breaking of the past and bringing good luck to their new life together. The broken glass represents fortune in the future.

title: Arras Ceremony
fullDescription: During the wedding ceremony, the groom presents the bride with 13 gold coins, symbolizing his willingness to support her. This exchange represents mutual trust and commitment.

title: Napkin Waving
shortDescription: Waving napkins to celebrate the couple
fullDescription: At Spanish wedding receptions, guests wave napkins above their heads to celebrate the arrival of the newlyweds at the reception. This joyful tradition symbolizes happiness and excitement for the couple.

title: Keeping Your Own Surname
fullDescription: In Spain, it is customary for both the bride and groom to keep their own surnames after marriage. This tradition reflects the Spanish naming system, where family names are passed down without change.
